meanings.definition: To form or arrange in the shape of a steeple.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys steepling her fingers when she is thinking deeply.
meanings.sent2: The children were steepling their blocks to build a tall tower.
meanings.sent3: The cat was steepling its tail in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The trees steepling against the sky looked majestic.
meanings.sent5: The chef was steepling the spaghetti on the plate for an elegant presentation.

meanings.definition: To raise or hold up high, as if forming a steeple.
meanings.sent1: He was steepling his umbrella to shield himself from the rain.
meanings.sent2: The conductor steepled his baton before starting the orchestra.
meanings.sent3: The giraffe was steepling its neck to reach the leaves on the tree.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peaks steepling into the clouds were a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: She was steepling her voice to be heard over the crowd.

meanings.definition: The act of forming or arranging in the shape of a steeple.
meanings.sent1: The steepling of the sandcastles was a fun activity at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The steepling of the cards in a house of cards requires precision.
meanings.sent3: The steepling of the cupcakes on the stand made them look like a tower.
meanings.sent4: The steepling of the skyscrapers in the city created a stunning skyline.
meanings.sent5: The steepling of the books on the shelf made them easy to find.
